quotes.quote: When you judge others, you do not define them, you define yourself.
Judge tenderly, if you must. There is usually a side you have not heard, a story you know nothing about, and a battle waged that you are not having to fight.
Don't judge too harshly, for if your weaknesses were to be placed under your footsteps, most likely you would stumble and fall as well.
Judge me if you want, but at the end of my life I choose to have memories not regrets.

When you judge other people without wanting to know the true story behind their actions, is usually when there is something inside of you that is so broken that if you found out what you believed about them was a lie, you wouldn't want to accept it or mak
We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
Judgements prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.
I can usually judge a fellow by what he laughs at.
If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
Judge a tree from its fruit, not from its leaves.
Let the Lord judge the criminals.
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
Judgement comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgement.
Before you start to judge me, Step into my shoes and walk  the life I'm living and if you get as far as I am, just maybe  you will see how strong I really am.
Outward judgment often fails, inward judgment never.
I'm not judging people, I'm judging their actions. It's the same type of distinction that I try to apply to myself, to judge, but not be judgmental.
Do not judge, or you too will be judged. For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.(Matthew 7:12)

We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.
To judge individuals before understanding them is a form of human rejection and feeds upon itself.
The least amount of judging we can do, the better off we are.
You can't judge people and touch their souls at the same time.
People will judge you for no reason. Use the stones they cast to build a solid foundation because once you are strong, you are unstoppable.
It is an unnecessary burden to make negative judgmental assumptions about others. We are all on a journey.
When we are judging everything, we are learning nothing.
People hasten to judge in order not to be judged themselves.
The more one judges, the less one loves.
Judging others makes us blind, whereas love is illuminating.
The greatest sin is judgment without knowledge.
Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
Do not condemn the judgment of another because it differs from your own. You may both be wrong.
If you judge, investigate.
Don't judge men's wealth or godliness by their Sunday appearance.
Don't judge a book by its cover.
Judge not thy neighbor until thou art come into his place.
No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
If two friends ask you to judge a dispute, don't accept, because you will lose one friend; on the other hand, if two strangers come with the same request, accept because you will gain one friend.
We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done.
We judge others by their behavior. We judge ourselves by our intentions.
We are all inclined to judge ourselves by our ideals; others by their acts.
A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
Before the throne of the Almighty, man will be judged not by his acts but by his intentions. For God alone reads our hearts.
Our judgements judge us, and nothing reveals us, exposes our weaknesses, more ingeniously than the attitude of pronouncing upon our fellows.
Let every man judge according to his own standards, by what he has himself read, not by what others tell him.
He who judges the colors of man, must have forgotten that the color of his blood is the same as any other.
Before you judge others, first judge yourself.
In judging others a man laboreth in vain; he often erreth, and easily falleth into sin; but in judging and examining himself he always laboreth to good purpose.
I Resist the Temptation to Judge Others.
By judging others we blind ourselves to our own evil and to the grace which others are just as entitled to as we are.
